title: How to Cook Nopales

steps.headline: Trim the outer edge from 6 nopales pads.
steps.description: Set your nopales on a cutting board and use a sharp knife to cut off the entire edge from each nopal. Cut about 1/4 in (6 mm) away from the edge. If you haven't worked with nopales before, wear gloves to protect your hands from the sharp prickles. If you prefer, you can prepare only a few nopales at a time.

steps.headline: Scrape off the spines from both sides of each nopal.
steps.description: Carefully use the knife to cut away all of the prickly spines or thorns. To ensure that you remove all of them, run the knife back to front. Then rinse the nopales and put them back on your cutting board.

steps.headline: Bring 4 quarts (3.8 l) of water to a boil while you cut the nopales.
steps.description: Pour the water into a large pot and set it on the stove. Cover the pot and turn the burner to high so the water comes to a boil. While you're waiting for the water to boil, cut the nopales into pieces or strips. Cut or slice the nopales into any size you like.

steps.headline: Add the nopales, tomatillo husk, onion, garlic, and salt.
steps.description: Stir the nopales, husk, 1/4 of an onion, 1 garlic clove, and 1/2 teaspoon (2.5 g) of salt into the boiling water. The water should quickly come back to a boil.

steps.headline: Boil the nopales for 8 to 10 minutes.
steps.description: Leave the lid off of the pot and let the water boil vigorously. The nopales will soften as it cooks. You'll also see a sticky substance rise to the top of the water along with foam. If it looks like the foam will boil over the side of your pot, turn the burner down a little.

steps.headline: Drain and rinse the boiled nopales.
steps.description: Turn off the burner and set a colander in the sink. Carefully pour the nopales into the colander so the water drains. Then run cold water over the nopales and let them drain again. If you want to completely dry the nopales, pat them with paper towels. Use the nopales immediately in your recipe or store them in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 3 to 5 days.

steps.headline: Sauté the nopales if you don't want to boil them.
steps.description: Once you've chopped the nopales or cut them into strips, heat 2 teaspoons (9.9 ml) of vegetable oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Stir in the nopales and 1 pinch of salt. Sauté the nopales for 2 minutes and then turn the burner down to medium. Cover the skillet and cook the nopales for 20 minutes. Any liquid in the skillet should cook off once the nopales have finished cooking.

steps.headline: Scramble nopales with eggs to make nopales con huevos.
steps.description: Sauté half of a chopped onion in the oil for 5 minutes and stir in 2 chopped nopales pads that you've already cooked. Cook the mixture for another 3 minutes over medium heat. Then stir in 4 beaten eggs and cook them until they're as firm as you like. Season the dish with salt, pepper, and chopped cilantro. Serve the nopales con huevos with soft corn or flour tortillas.

steps.headline: Mix up nopales salad.
steps.description: Put 6 chopped nopales that you've cooked into a large serving bowl. Stir in 1 1/2 cup (300 g) of chopped tomatoes, 2 finely chopped serrano peppers, 1/2 cup (25 g) of chopped cilantro, and 1/2 cup (75 g) of chopped onion. In another bowl, mix 2 tablespoons (30 ml) of lemon juice, ⁄3 cup (79 ml) of olive oil, 1 teaspoon (1 g) of Mexican oregano, and salt and pepper to taste. Toss this with the nopales mixture. Serve the nopales salad with slices of avocado, 1/2 cup (60 g) of crumbled fresh cheese, and corn tortillas or tostadas.

steps.headline: Make nopales tacos.
steps.description: Put 3 to 4 chopped nopales that you've sautéed into a skillet. Stir in 1/2 of a sliced red onion and cook the mixture for 3 minutes over medium heat. Stir in 3/4 cup (40 g) of chopped cilantro, ⁄4 cup (59 ml) of lime juice, ⁄4 cup (180 ml) of soy sauce, and 1 chopped serrano chile. Cover the mixture and cook it for 3 minutes before serving. To assemble the tacos, heat 8 corn tortillas until they're soft. Hold 2 tortillas in your hand and spoon some of the nopales filling and guacamole into the center. Fold the tacos and serve them immediately.

steps.headline: Cook nopales with ground beef.
steps.description: Stir and cook 1 pound (450 g) of ground beef in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Once the meat is completely browned, drain off the grease and stir in 1/2 cup (75 g) of chopped onions. Cook the mixture for 3 more minutes and stir in 1 pound (450 g) of prepared nopales, 2 tablespoons (29.6 ml) (12.5 g) of Mexican spice blend, and 1 can (14 ounces or 411 g) of diced tomatoes. Turn the burner to medium-low and simmer the ground beef nopales sauce for 20 minutes. Serve the ground beef nopales sauce with rice and corn tortillas.
